description: Creates a Traffic Mirror session. A Traffic Mirror session actively copies packets from a Traffic Mirror source to a Traffic Mirror target. Create a filter, and then assign it to the session to define a subset of the traffic to mirror, for example all TCP traffic. The Traffic Mirror source and the Traffic Mirror target (monitoring appliances) can be in the same VPC, or in a different VPC connected via VPC peering or a transit gateway. By default, no traffic is mirrored. Use CreateTrafficMirrorFilter to create filter rules that specify the traffic to mirror.

parameters.name: NetworkInterfaceId
parameters.description: The ID of the source network interface.

parameters.name: TrafficMirrorTargetId
parameters.description: The ID of the Traffic Mirror target.

parameters.name: TrafficMirrorFilterId
parameters.description: The ID of the Traffic Mirror filter.

parameters.name: PacketLength
parameters.description: The number of bytes in each packet to mirror. These are bytes after the VXLAN header. Do not specify this parameter when you want to mirror the entire packet. To mirror a subset of the packet, set this to the length (in bytes) that you want to mirror. For example, if you set this value to 100, then the first 100 bytes that meet the filter criteria are copied to the target. If you do not want to mirror the entire packet, use the PacketLength parameter to specify the number of bytes in each packet to mirror. For sessions with Network Load Balancer (NLB) Traffic Mirror targets the default PacketLength will be set to 8500. Valid values are 1-8500. Setting a PacketLength greater than 8500 will result in an error response.

parameters.name: SessionNumber
parameters.description: The session number determines the order in which sessions are evaluated when an interface is used by multiple sessions. The first session with a matching filter is the one that mirrors the packets. Valid values are 1-32766.

parameters.name: TagSpecifications
parameters.description: The tags to assign to a Traffic Mirror session. (dict) --- The tags to apply to a resource when the resource is being created. When you specify a tag, you must specify the resource type to tag, otherwise the request will fail. ResourceType (string) --- The type of resource to tag on creation. Tags (list) --- The tags to apply to the resource. (dict) --- Describes a tag. Key (string) --- The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:. Value (string) --- The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

nested_params.name: ResourceType
nested_params.description: The type of resource to tag on creation.

nested_params.name: Tags
nested_params.description: The tags to apply to the resource.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: Unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. For more information, see How to ensure idempotency. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

nested_items.name: TrafficMirrorSession
nested_items.description: Information about the Traffic Mirror session.

nested_items.name: TrafficMirrorSessionId
nested_items.description: The ID for the Traffic Mirror session.

nested_items.name: TrafficMirrorTargetId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Traffic Mirror target.

nested_items.name: TrafficMirrorFilterId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Traffic Mirror filter.

nested_items.name: NetworkInterfaceId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Traffic Mirror session's network interface.

nested_items.name: OwnerId
nested_items.description: The ID of the account that owns the Traffic Mirror session.

nested_items.name: PacketLength
nested_items.description: The number of bytes in each packet to mirror. These are the bytes after the VXLAN header. To mirror a subset, set this to the length (in bytes) to mirror. For example, if you set this value to 100, then the first 100 bytes that meet the filter criteria are copied to the target. Do not specify this parameter when you want to mirror the entire packet.

nested_items.name: SessionNumber
nested_items.description: The session number determines the order in which sessions are evaluated when an interface is used by multiple sessions. The first session with a matching filter is the one that mirrors the packets.

nested_items.name: VirtualNetworkId
nested_items.description: The virtual network ID associated with the Traffic Mirror session.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The description of the Traffic Mirror session.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The tags assigned to the Traffic Mirror session.
